item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "Man's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr
item.description: "Men do not quit playing because they grow old; they grow old because they quit playing." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "Death tugs at my ear and says, 'Live. I am coming." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "A moment's insight is sometimes worth a life's experience." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.
item.description: "Once the mind has been stretched by a new idea, it will never again return to its original size." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes
item.description: "The young man knows the rules but the old man knows the exceptions." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "Science is a first-rate piece of furniture for a man's upper chamber, if he has common sense on the ground floor." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "Chicago sounds rough to the maker of verse. One comfort we have - Cincinnati sounds worse." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Samuel Clemens
item.description: "What work I have done I have done because it has been play. If it had been work I shouldn't have done it. . . . The work that is really a man's own work is play and not work at all. . . . When we talk about the great workers of the world we really mean the great players of the world." -- Samuel Clemens

item.title: Domingo add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The reports of my death are greatly exaggerated." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "But who prays for Satan? Who, in eighteen centuries, has had the common humanity to pray for the one sinner that needed it most?" -- mark twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I did not attend his funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Domingo add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain
